RGFW
A multi-platform single-header very simple-to-use framework library for creating GUI Libraries or simple GUI programs.
Loading...
Searching...
No Matches
RGFW.h
Go to the documentation of this file.

28/*
29 (MAKE SURE RGFW_IMPLEMENTATION is in exactly one header or you use -D RGFW_IMPLEMENTATION)
30 #define RGFW_IMPLEMENTATION - makes it so source code is included with header
31*/
32
33/*
34 #define RGFW_IMPLEMENTATION - (required) makes it so the source code is included
35 #define RGFW_DEBUG - (optional) makes it so RGFW prints debug messages and errors when they're found
36 #define RGFW_EGL - (optional) compile with OpenGL functions, allowing you to use to use EGL instead of the native OpenGL functions
37 #define RGFW_DIRECTX - (optional) include integration directX functions (windows only)
38 #define RGFW_VULKAN - (optional) include helpful vulkan integration functions and macros
39 #define RGFW_WEBGPU - (optional) use WebGPU for rendering
40 #define RGFW_NATIVE - (optional) define native RGFW types that use native API structures
41
42 #define RGFW_X11 (optional) (unix only) if X11 should be used. This option is turned on by default by unix systems except for MacOS
43 #define RGFW_WAYLAND (optional) (unix only) use Wayland. (This can be used with X11)
44 #define RGFW_NO_X11 (optional) (unix only) don't fallback to X11 when using Wayland
45 #define RGFW_NO_LOAD_WGL (optional) (windows only) if WGL should be loaded dynamically during runtime
46 #define RGFW_NO_X11_CURSOR (optional) (unix only) don't use XCursor
47 #define RGFW_NO_X11_CURSOR_PRELOAD (optional) (unix only) use XCursor, but don't link it in code, (you'll have to link it with -lXcursor)
48 #define RGFW_NO_X11_EXT_PRELOAD (optional) (unix only) use Xext, but don't link it in code, (you'll have to link it with -lXext)
49 #define RGFW_NO_LOAD_WINMM (optional) (windows only) use winmm (timeBeginPeriod), but don't link it in code, (you'll have to link it with -lwinmm)
50 #define RGFW_NO_WINMM (optional) (windows only) don't use winmm
51 #define RGFW_NO_IOKIT (optional) (macOS) don't use IOKit
52 #define RGFW_NO_UNIX_CLOCK (optional) (unix) don't link unix clock functions
53 #define RGFW_NO_DWM (windows only) - do not use or link dwmapi
54 #define RGFW_USE_XDL (optional) (X11) if XDL (XLib Dynamic Loader) should be used to load X11 dynamically during runtime (must include XDL.h along with RGFW)
55 #define RGFW_COCOA_GRAPHICS_SWITCHING - (optional) (cocoa) use automatic graphics switching (allow the system to choose to use GPU or iGPU)
56 #define RGFW_COCOA_FRAME_NAME (optional) (cocoa) set frame name
57 #define RGFW_NO_DPI - do not calculate DPI (no XRM nor libShcore included)
58 #define RGFW_ADVANCED_SMOOTH_RESIZE - use advanced methods for smooth resizing (may result in a spike in memory usage or worse performance) (eg. WM_TIMER and XSyncValue)
59 #define RGFW_NO_INFO - do not define the RGFW_info struct (without RGFW_IMPLEMENTATION)
60 #define RGFW_NO_GLXWINDOW - do not use GLXWindow
61
62 #define RGFW_ALLOC x - choose the default allocation function (defaults to standard malloc)
63 #define RGFW_FREE x - choose the default deallocation function (defaults to standard free)
64 #define RGFW_USERPTR x - choose the default userptr sent to the malloc call, (NULL by default)
65
66 #define RGFW_EXPORT - use when building RGFW
67 #define RGFW_IMPORT - use when linking with RGFW (not as a single-header)
68
69 #define RGFW_USE_INT - force the use c-types rather than stdint.h (for systems that might not have stdint.h (msvc))
70 #define RGFW_bool x - choose what type to use for bool, by default u32 is used
71*/
72
73/*
74Example to get you started :
75
76linux : gcc main.c -lX11 -lXrandr -lGL
77windows : gcc main.c -lopengl32 -lgdi32
78macos : gcc main.c -framework Cocoa -framework CoreVideo -framework OpenGL -framework IOKit
79
80#define RGFW_IMPLEMENTATION
81#include "RGFW.h"
82
83u8 icon[4 * 3 * 3] = {0xFF, 0x00, 0x00, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0x00, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0x00, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00, 0xFF};
84
85int main() {
86 RGFW_window* win = RGFW_createWindow("name", 100, 100, 500, 500, (u64)0);
87 RGFW_event event;
88
89 RGFW_window_setExitKey(win, RGFW_escape);
90 RGFW_window_setIcon(win, icon, 3, 3, RGFW_formatRGBA8);
91
92 while (RGFW_window_shouldClose(win) == RGFW_FALSE) {
93 while (RGFW_window_checkEvent(win, &event)) {
94 if (event.type == RGFW_quit)
95 break;
96 }
97 }
98
99 RGFW_window_close(win);
100}
101
102 compiling :
103
104 if you wish to compile the library all you have to do is create a new file with this in it
105
106 rgfw.c
107 #define RGFW_IMPLEMENTATION
108 #include "RGFW.h"
109
110 You may also want to add
111 `#define RGFW_EXPORT` when compiling and
112 `#define RGFW_IMPORT`when linking RGFW on it's own:
113 this reduces inline functions and prevents bloat in the object file
114
115 then you can use gcc (or whatever compile you wish to use) to compile the library into object file
116
117 ex. gcc -c RGFW.c -fPIC
118
119 after you compile the library into an object file, you can also turn the object file into an static or shared library
120
121 (commands ar and gcc can be replaced with whatever equivalent your system uses)
122
123 static : ar rcs RGFW.a RGFW.o
124 shared :
125 windows:
126 gcc -shared RGFW.o -lopengl32 -lgdi32 -o RGFW.dll
127 linux:
128 gcc -shared RGFW.o -lX11 -lGL -lXrandr -o RGFW.so
129 macos:
130 gcc -shared RGFW.o -framework CoreVideo -framework Cocoa -framework OpenGL -framework IOKit
131*/
132
133
134

136 Credits :
137 EimaMei/Sacode : Code review, helped with X11, MacOS and Windows support, Silicon, siliapp.h -> referencing
138
139 stb : This project is heavily inspired by the stb single header files

173#if _MSC_VER
174 #pragma comment(lib, "gdi32")
175 #pragma comment(lib, "shell32")
176 #pragma comment(lib, "User32")
177 #pragma warning( push )
178 #pragma warning( disable : 4996 4191 4127)
179 #if _MSC_VER < 600
180 #define RGFW_C89
181 #endif
182#else
183 #if defined(__STDC__) && !defined(__STDC_VERSION__)
184 #define RGFW_C89
185 #endif
186#endif
187
188#if defined(RGFW_EGL) && !defined(RGFW_OPENGL)
189 #define RGFW_OPENGL
190#endif
191
192/* these OS macros look better & are standardized */
193/* plus it helps with cross-compiling */
194
195#ifdef __EMSCRIPTEN__
196 #define RGFW_WASM
197#endif
198
199#if defined(RGFW_X11) && defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(RGFW_CUSTOM_BACKEND)
200 #define RGFW_MACOS_X11
201 #define RGFW_UNIX
202#endif
203
204#if defined(_WIN32) && !defined(RGFW_X11) && !defined(RGFW_UNIX) && !defined(RGFW_WASM) && !defined(RGFW_CUSTOM_BACKEND) /* (if you're using X11 on windows some how) */
205 #define RGFW_WINDOWS
206#endif
207#if defined(RGFW_WAYLAND)
208 #define RGFW_DEBUG /* wayland will be in debug mode by default for now */
209 #define RGFW_UNIX
210 #ifdef RGFW_OPENGL
211 #define RGFW_EGL
212 #endif
213 #ifdef RGFW_X11
214 #define RGFW_DYNAMIC
215 #endif
216#endif
217#if (!defined(RGFW_WAYLAND) && !defined(RGFW_X11)) && (defined(__unix__) || defined(RGFW_MACOS_X11) || defined(RGFW_X11)) && !defined(RGFW_WASM) && !defined(RGFW_CUSTOM_BACKEND)
218 #define RGFW_MACOS_X11
219 #define RGFW_X11
220 #define RGFW_UNIX
221#elif defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(RGFW_MACOS_X11) && !defined(RGFW_X11) && !defined(RGFW_WASM) && !defined(RGFW_CUSTOM_BACKEND)
222 #define RGFW_MACOS
223#endif
224
225#ifndef RGFW_ASSERT
226 #include <assert.h>
227 #define RGFW_ASSERT assert
228#endif
229
230#if !defined(__STDC_VERSION__)
231 #define RGFW_C89
232#endif
233
234#if !defined(RGFW_SNPRINTF) && (defined(RGFW_X11) || defined(RGFW_WAYLAND))
235
236 /* required for X11 errors */
237 #include <stdio.h>
238
239 #ifdef RGFW_C89
240 #include <stdarg.h>
241 static int RGFW_c89_snprintf(char *dst, size_t size, const char *format, ...) {
242 va_list args;
243 size_t count = 0;
244 va_start(args, format);
245 count = (size_t)vsprintf(dst, format, args);
246 RGFW_ASSERT(count + 1 < size && "Buffer overflow");
247 va_end(args);
248 return (int)count;
249 }
250 #define RGFW_SNPRINTF RGFW_c89_snprintf
251 #else
252 #define RGFW_SNPRINTF snprintf
253 #endif /*RGFW_C89*/
254#endif
255
256#ifndef RGFW_USERPTR
257 #define RGFW_USERPTR NULL
258#endif
259
260#ifndef RGFW_UNUSED
261 #define RGFW_UNUSED(x) (void)(x)
262#endif
263
264#ifndef RGFW_ROUND
265 #define RGFW_ROUND(x) (i32)((x) >= 0 ? (x) + 0.5f : (x) - 0.5f)
266#endif
267
268#ifndef RGFW_MIN
269 #define RGFW_MIN(x, y) ((x < y) ? x : y)
270#endif
271
272#ifndef RGFW_ALLOC
273 #include <stdlib.h>
274 #define RGFW_ALLOC malloc
275 #define RGFW_FREE free
276#endif
277
278#if !defined(RGFW_MEMCPY) || !defined(RGFW_STRNCMP) || !defined(RGFW_STRNCPY) || !defined(RGFW_MEMSET)
279 #include <string.h>
280#endif
281
282#ifndef RGFW_MEMSET
283 #define RGFW_MEMSET(ptr, value, num) memset(ptr, value, num)
284#endif
285
286#ifndef RGFW_MEMCPY
287 #define RGFW_MEMCPY(dist, src, len) memcpy(dist, src, len)
288#endif
289
290#ifndef RGFW_STRNCMP
291 #define RGFW_STRNCMP(s1, s2, max) strncmp(s1, s2, max)
292#endif
293
294#ifndef RGFW_STRNCPY
295 #define RGFW_STRNCPY(dist, src, len) strncpy(dist, src, len)
296#endif
297
298#ifndef RGFW_STRSTR
299 #define RGFW_STRSTR(str, substr) strstr(str, substr)
300#endif
301
302#ifndef RGFW_STRTOL
303 /* required for X11 XDnD and X11 Monitor DPI */
304 #include <stdlib.h>
305 #define RGFW_STRTOL(str, endptr, base) strtol(str, endptr, base)
306 #define RGFW_ATOF(num) atof(num)
307#endif
308
309#if !defined(RGFW_PRINTF) && ( defined(RGFW_DEBUG) || defined(RGFW_WAYLAND) )
310 /* required when using RGFW_DEBUG */
311 #include <stdio.h>
312 #define RGFW_PRINTF printf
313#endif
314
315#ifndef RGFW_MAX_PATH
316 #define RGFW_MAX_PATH 260 /* max length of a path (for drag andn drop) */
317#endif
318#ifndef RGFW_MAX_DROPS
319 #define RGFW_MAX_DROPS 260 /* max items you can drop at once */
320#endif
321
322#ifndef RGFW_MAX_EVENTS
323 #define RGFW_MAX_EVENTS 32
324#endif
325
326#ifndef RGFW_MAX_MONITORS
327 #define RGFW_MAX_MONITORS 6
328#endif
329
330#ifndef RGFW_COCOA_FRAME_NAME
331 #define RGFW_COCOA_FRAME_NAME NULL
332#endif
333
334#ifdef RGFW_WIN95 /* for windows 95 testing (not that it really works) */
335 #define RGFW_NO_MONITOR
336 #define RGFW_NO_PASSTHROUGH
337#endif
338
339#if defined(RGFW_EXPORT) || defined(RGFW_IMPORT)
340 #if defined(_WIN32)
341 #if defined(__TINYC__) && (defined(RGFW_EXPORT) || defined(RGFW_IMPORT))
342 #define __declspec(x) __attribute__((x))
343 #endif
344
345 #if defined(RGFW_EXPORT)
346 #define RGFWDEF __declspec(dllexport)
347 #else
348 #define RGFWDEF __declspec(dllimport)
349 #endif
350 #else
351 #if defined(RGFW_EXPORT)
352 #define RGFWDEF __attribute__((visibility("default")))
353 #endif
354 #endif
355 #ifndef RGFWDEF
356 #define RGFWDEF
357 #endif
358#endif
359
360#ifndef RGFWDEF
361 #ifdef RGFW_C89
362 #define RGFWDEF __inline
363 #else
364 #define RGFWDEF inline
365 #endif
366#endif
367
368#if defined(__cplusplus) && !defined(__EMSCRIPTEN__)
369 extern "C" {
370#endif
371
372/* makes sure the header file part is only defined once by default */
373#ifndef RGFW_HEADER
374
375#define RGFW_HEADER
376
377#include <stddef.h>
378#ifndef RGFW_INT_DEFINED
379 #ifdef RGFW_USE_INT /* optional for any system that might not have stdint.h */
380 typedef unsigned char u8;
381 typedef signed char i8;
382 typedef unsigned short u16;
383 typedef signed short i16;
384 typedef unsigned long int u32;
385 typedef signed long int i32;
386 typedef unsigned long long u64;
387 typedef signed long long i64;
388 #else /* use stdint standard types instead of c "standard" types */
389 #include <stdint.h>
390
391 typedef uint8_t u8;
392 typedef int8_t i8;
393 typedef uint16_t u16;
394 typedef int16_t i16;
395 typedef uint32_t u32;
396 typedef int32_t i32;
397 typedef uint64_t u64;
398 typedef int64_t i64;
399 #endif
400 #define RGFW_INT_DEFINED
401#endif
402
403typedef ptrdiff_t RGFW_ssize_t;
404
405#ifndef RGFW_BOOL_DEFINED
406 #define RGFW_BOOL_DEFINED
407 typedef u8 RGFW_bool;
408#endif
409
410#define RGFW_BOOL(x) (RGFW_bool)((x) != 0) /* force a value to be 0 or 1 */
411#define RGFW_TRUE (RGFW_bool)1
412#define RGFW_FALSE (RGFW_bool)0
413
414#define RGFW_ENUM(type, name) type name; enum
415#define RGFW_BIT(x) (1 << (x))
416
417#ifdef RGFW_VULKAN
418
419 #if defined(RGFW_WAYLAND) && defined(RGFW_X11)
420 #define VK_USE_PLATFORM_WAYLAND_KHR
421 #define VK_USE_PLATFORM_XLIB_KHR
422 #define RGFW_VK_SURFACE ((RGFW_usingWayland()) ? ("VK_KHR_wayland_surface") : ("VK_KHR_xlib_surface"))
423 #elif defined(RGFW_WAYLAND)
424 #define VK_USE_PLATFORM_WAYLAND_KHR
425 #define VK_USE_PLATFORM_XLIB_KHR
426 #define RGFW_VK_SURFACE "VK_KHR_wayland_surface"
427 #elif defined(RGFW_X11)
428 #define VK_USE_PLATFORM_XLIB_KHR
429 #define RGFW_VK_SURFACE "VK_KHR_xlib_surface"
430 #elif defined(RGFW_WINDOWS)
431 #define VK_USE_PLATFORM_WIN32_KHR
432 #define OEMRESOURCE
433 #define RGFW_VK_SURFACE "VK_KHR_win32_surface"
434 #elif defined(RGFW_MACOS) && !defined(RGFW_MACOS_X11)
435 #define VK_USE_PLATFORM_MACOS_MVK
436 #define RGFW_VK_SURFACE "VK_MVK_macos_surface"
437 #else
438 #define RGFW_VK_SURFACE NULL
439 #endif
440
441#endif
442
443
445typedef struct RGFW_info RGFW_info;
446
448typedef struct RGFW_window RGFW_window;
449
451typedef struct RGFW_window_src RGFW_window_src;

454typedef RGFW_ENUM(u8, RGFW_format) {
455 RGFW_formatRGB8 = 0,
456 RGFW_formatBGR8,
457 RGFW_formatRGBA8,
458 RGFW_formatARGB8,
459 RGFW_formatBGRA8,
460 RGFW_formatABGR8,
461 RGFW_formatCount
462};

465typedef struct RGFW_nativeImage RGFW_nativeImage;
466
468typedef struct RGFW_surface RGFW_surface;
469
471typedef void RGFW_mouse;
472
474typedef RGFW_ENUM(u8, RGFW_key) {
475 RGFW_keyNULL = 0,
476 RGFW_escape = '\033',
477 RGFW_backtick = '`',
478 RGFW_0 = '0',
479 RGFW_1 = '1',
480 RGFW_2 = '2',
481 RGFW_3 = '3',
482 RGFW_4 = '4',
483 RGFW_5 = '5',
484 RGFW_6 = '6',
485 RGFW_7 = '7',
486 RGFW_8 = '8',
487 RGFW_9 = '9',
488 RGFW_minus = '-',
489 RGFW_equals = '=',
490 RGFW_backSpace = '\b',
491 RGFW_tab = '\t',
492 RGFW_space = ' ',
493 RGFW_a = 'a',
494 RGFW_b = 'b',
495 RGFW_c = 'c',
496 RGFW_d = 'd',
497 RGFW_e = 'e',
498 RGFW_f = 'f',
499 RGFW_g = 'g',
500 RGFW_h = 'h',
501 RGFW_i = 'i',
502 RGFW_j = 'j',
503 RGFW_k = 'k',
504 RGFW_l = 'l',
505 RGFW_m = 'm',
506 RGFW_n = 'n',
507 RGFW_o = 'o',
508 RGFW_p = 'p',
509 RGFW_q = 'q',
510 RGFW_r = 'r',
511 RGFW_s = 's',
512 RGFW_t = 't',
513 RGFW_u = 'u',
514 RGFW_v = 'v',
515 RGFW_w = 'w',
516 RGFW_x = 'x',
517 RGFW_y = 'y',
518 RGFW_z = 'z',
519 RGFW_period = '.',
520 RGFW_comma = ',',
521 RGFW_slash = '/',
522 RGFW_bracket = '[',
523 RGFW_closeBracket = ']',
524 RGFW_semicolon = ';',
525 RGFW_apostrophe = '\'',
526 RGFW_backSlash = '\\',
527 RGFW_return = '\n',
528 RGFW_enter = RGFW_return,
529 RGFW_delete = '\177', /* 127 */
530 RGFW_F1,
531 RGFW_F2,
532 RGFW_F3,
533 RGFW_F4,
534 RGFW_F5,
535 RGFW_F6,
536 RGFW_F7,
537 RGFW_F8,
538 RGFW_F9,
539 RGFW_F10,
540 RGFW_F11,
541 RGFW_F12,
542 RGFW_F13,
543 RGFW_F14,
544 RGFW_F15,
545 RGFW_F16,
546 RGFW_F17,
547 RGFW_F18,
548 RGFW_F19,
549 RGFW_F20,
550 RGFW_F21,
551 RGFW_F22,
552 RGFW_F23,
553 RGFW_F24,
554 RGFW_F25,
555 RGFW_capsLock,
556 RGFW_shiftL,
557 RGFW_controlL,
558 RGFW_altL,
559 RGFW_superL,
560 RGFW_shiftR,
561 RGFW_controlR,
562 RGFW_altR,
563 RGFW_superR,
564 RGFW_up,
565 RGFW_down,
566 RGFW_left,
567 RGFW_right,
568 RGFW_insert,
569 RGFW_menu,
570 RGFW_end,
571 RGFW_home,
572 RGFW_pageUp,
573 RGFW_pageDown,
574 RGFW_numLock,
575 RGFW_kpSlash,
576 RGFW_kpMultiply,
577 RGFW_kpPlus,
578 RGFW_kpMinus,
579 RGFW_kpEqual,
580 RGFW_kp1,
581 RGFW_kp2,
582 RGFW_kp3,
583 RGFW_kp4,
584 RGFW_kp5,
585 RGFW_kp6,
586 RGFW_kp7,
587 RGFW_kp8,
588 RGFW_kp9,
589 RGFW_kp0,
590 RGFW_kpPeriod,
591 RGFW_kpReturn,
592 RGFW_scrollLock,
593 RGFW_printScreen,
594 RGFW_pause,
595 RGFW_world1,
596 RGFW_world2,
597 RGFW_keyLast = 256 /* padding for alignment ~(175 by default) */
598};
599
601typedef RGFW_ENUM(u8, RGFW_mouseButton) {
602 RGFW_mouseLeft = 0,
603 RGFW_mouseMiddle,
604 RGFW_mouseRight,
605 RGFW_mouseMisc1, RGFW_mouseMisc2, RGFW_mouseMisc3, RGFW_mouseMisc4, RGFW_mouseMisc5,
606 RGFW_mouseFinal
607};
608
610typedef RGFW_ENUM(u8, RGFW_keymod) {
611 RGFW_modCapsLock = RGFW_BIT(0),
612 RGFW_modNumLock = RGFW_BIT(1),
613 RGFW_modControl = RGFW_BIT(2),
614 RGFW_modAlt = RGFW_BIT(3),
615 RGFW_modShift = RGFW_BIT(4),
616 RGFW_modSuper = RGFW_BIT(5),
617 RGFW_modScrollLock = RGFW_BIT(6)
618};
619
621typedef RGFW_ENUM(u8, RGFW_eventType) {
622 RGFW_eventNone = 0,
623 RGFW_keyPressed, /* a key has been pressed */
624 RGFW_keyReleased,
636 RGFW_mouseButtonPressed,
637 RGFW_mouseButtonReleased,
638 RGFW_mouseScroll,
639 RGFW_mousePosChanged,
645 RGFW_windowMoved,
646 RGFW_windowResized,
647 RGFW_focusIn,
648 RGFW_focusOut,
649 RGFW_mouseEnter, /* mouse entered the window */
650 RGFW_mouseLeave, /* mouse left the window */
651 RGFW_windowRefresh, /* The window content needs to be refreshed */
652
653 /* attribs change event note
654 The event data is sent straight to the window structure
655 with win->x, win->y, win->w and win->h
656 */
657 RGFW_quit,
658 RGFW_dataDrop,
659 RGFW_dataDrag,
660 /* drop data note
661 The x and y coords of the drop are stored in the vector RGFW_x, y
662
663 RGFW_event.drop.count holds how many files were dropped
664
665 This is also the size of the array which stores all the dropped file string,
666 RGFW_event.drop.files
667 */
668 RGFW_windowMaximized,
669 RGFW_windowMinimized,
670 RGFW_windowRestored,
671 RGFW_scaleUpdated
672};
673
675typedef RGFW_ENUM(u32, RGFW_eventFlag) {
676 RGFW_keyPressedFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_keyPressed),
677 RGFW_keyReleasedFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_keyReleased),
678 RGFW_mouseScrollFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_mouseScroll),
679 RGFW_mouseButtonPressedFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_mouseButtonPressed),
680 RGFW_mouseButtonReleasedFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_mouseButtonReleased),
681 RGFW_mousePosChangedFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_mousePosChanged),
682 RGFW_mouseEnterFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_mouseEnter),
683 RGFW_mouseLeaveFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_mouseLeave),
684 RGFW_windowMovedFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_windowMoved),
685 RGFW_windowResizedFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_windowResized),
686 RGFW_focusInFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_focusIn),
687 RGFW_focusOutFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_focusOut),
688 RGFW_windowRefreshFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_windowRefresh),
689 RGFW_windowMaximizedFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_windowMaximized),
690 RGFW_windowMinimizedFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_windowMinimized),
691 RGFW_windowRestoredFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_windowRestored),
692 RGFW_scaleUpdatedFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_scaleUpdated),
693 RGFW_quitFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_quit),
694 RGFW_dataDropFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_dataDrop),
695 RGFW_dataDragFlag = RGFW_BIT(RGFW_dataDrag),
696
697 RGFW_keyEventsFlag = RGFW_keyPressedFlag | RGFW_keyReleasedFlag,
698 RGFW_mouseEventsFlag = RGFW_mouseButtonPressedFlag | RGFW_mouseButtonReleasedFlag | RGFW_mousePosChangedFlag | RGFW_mouseEnterFlag | RGFW_mouseLeaveFlag | RGFW_mouseScrollFlag ,
699 RGFW_windowEventsFlag = RGFW_windowMovedFlag | RGFW_windowResizedFlag | RGFW_windowRefreshFlag | RGFW_windowMaximizedFlag | RGFW_windowMinimizedFlag | RGFW_windowRestoredFlag | RGFW_scaleUpdatedFlag,
700 RGFW_focusEventsFlag = RGFW_focusInFlag | RGFW_focusOutFlag,
701 RGFW_dataDropEventsFlag = RGFW_dataDropFlag | RGFW_dataDragFlag,
702 RGFW_allEventFlags = RGFW_keyEventsFlag | RGFW_mouseEventsFlag | RGFW_windowEventsFlag | RGFW_focusEventsFlag | RGFW_dataDropEventsFlag | RGFW_quitFlag
703};
704
708typedef struct RGFW_commonEvent {
709 RGFW_eventType type;
710 RGFW_window* win;
711} RGFW_commonEvent;
712
714typedef struct RGFW_mouseButtonEvent {
715 RGFW_eventType type;
716 RGFW_window* win;
717 u8 value; /* !< which mouse button was pressed */
718} RGFW_mouseButtonEvent;
719
721typedef struct RGFW_mouseScrollEvent {
722 RGFW_eventType type;
723 RGFW_window* win;
724 float x, y;
725} RGFW_mouseScrollEvent;
726
728typedef struct RGFW_mousePosEvent {
729 RGFW_eventType type;
730 RGFW_window* win;
731 i32 x, y;
732 float vecX, vecY;
733} RGFW_mousePosEvent;
734
736typedef struct RGFW_keyEvent {
737 RGFW_eventType type;
738 RGFW_window* win;
739 RGFW_key value;
740 u8 sym;
741 RGFW_bool repeat;
742 RGFW_keymod mod;
743} RGFW_keyEvent;
744
746typedef struct RGFW_dataDropEvent {
747 RGFW_eventType type;
748 RGFW_window* win;
749 /* 260 max paths with a max length of 260 */
750 char** files;
751 size_t count;
752} RGFW_dataDropEvent;
753
755typedef struct RGFW_dataDragEvent {
756 RGFW_eventType type;
757 RGFW_window* win;
758 i32 x, y;
759} RGFW_dataDragEvent;
760
762typedef struct RGFW_scaleUpdatedEvent {
763 RGFW_eventType type;
764 RGFW_window* win;
765 float x, y;
766} RGFW_scaleUpdatedEvent;
767
769typedef union RGFW_event {
770 RGFW_eventType type;
771 RGFW_commonEvent common;
772 RGFW_mouseButtonEvent button;
773 RGFW_mouseScrollEvent scroll;
774 RGFW_mousePosEvent mouse;
775 RGFW_keyEvent key;
776 RGFW_dataDropEvent drop;
777 RGFW_dataDragEvent drag; /* data for dragging a file events */
778 RGFW_scaleUpdatedEvent scale; /* data for monitor scaling events */
779} RGFW_event;
780
788typedef RGFW_ENUM(i32, RGFW_eventWait) {
789 RGFW_eventNoWait = 0,
790 RGFW_eventWaitNext = -1
791};
792
793
794
796typedef RGFW_ENUM(u32, RGFW_windowFlags) {
797 RGFW_windowNoBorder = RGFW_BIT(0),
798 RGFW_windowNoResize = RGFW_BIT(1),
799 RGFW_windowAllowDND = RGFW_BIT(2),
800 RGFW_windowHideMouse = RGFW_BIT(3),
801 RGFW_windowFullscreen = RGFW_BIT(4),
802 RGFW_windowTransparent = RGFW_BIT(5),
803 RGFW_windowCenter = RGFW_BIT(6),
804 RGFW_windowScaleToMonitor = RGFW_BIT(8),
805 RGFW_windowHide = RGFW_BIT(9),
806 RGFW_windowMaximize = RGFW_BIT(10),
807 RGFW_windowCenterCursor = RGFW_BIT(11),
808 RGFW_windowFloating = RGFW_BIT(12),
809 RGFW_windowFocusOnShow = RGFW_BIT(13),
810 RGFW_windowMinimize = RGFW_BIT(14),
811 RGFW_windowFocus = RGFW_BIT(15),
812 RGFW_windowOpenGL = RGFW_BIT(17),
813 RGFW_windowEGL = RGFW_BIT(18),
814 RGFW_windowedFullscreen = RGFW_windowNoBorder | RGFW_windowMaximize
815};
816
818typedef RGFW_ENUM(u8, RGFW_icon) {
819 RGFW_iconTaskbar = RGFW_BIT(0),
820 RGFW_iconWindow = RGFW_BIT(1),
821 RGFW_iconBoth = RGFW_iconTaskbar | RGFW_iconWindow
822};
823
825typedef RGFW_ENUM(u8, RGFW_mouseIcons) {
826 RGFW_mouseNormal = 0,
827 RGFW_mouseArrow,
828 RGFW_mouseIbeam,
829 RGFW_mouseCrosshair,
830 RGFW_mousePointingHand,
831 RGFW_mouseResizeEW,
832 RGFW_mouseResizeNS,
833 RGFW_mouseResizeNWSE,
834 RGFW_mouseResizeNESW,
835 RGFW_mouseResizeAll,
836 RGFW_mouseNotAllowed,
837 RGFW_mouseIconCount,
838 RGFW_mouseIconFinal = 16 /* padding for alignment */
839};
840
842typedef RGFW_ENUM(u8, RGFW_debugType) {
843 RGFW_typeError = 0, RGFW_typeWarning, RGFW_typeInfo
844};
845
847typedef RGFW_ENUM(u8, RGFW_errorCode) {
848 RGFW_noError = 0,
849 RGFW_errOutOfMemory,
850 RGFW_errOpenGLContext, RGFW_errEGLContext,
851 RGFW_errWayland, RGFW_errX11,
852 RGFW_errDirectXContext,
853 RGFW_errIOKit,
854 RGFW_errClipboard,
855 RGFW_errFailedFuncLoad,
856 RGFW_errBuffer,
857 RGFW_errEventQueue,
858 RGFW_infoMonitor, RGFW_infoWindow, RGFW_infoBuffer, RGFW_infoGlobal, RGFW_infoOpenGL,
859 RGFW_warningWayland, RGFW_warningOpenGL
860};
861
863typedef void (* RGFW_debugfunc)(RGFW_debugType type, RGFW_errorCode err, const char* msg);
864
866typedef void (* RGFW_windowMovedfunc)(RGFW_window* win, i32 x, i32 y);
868typedef void (* RGFW_windowResizedfunc)(RGFW_window* win, i32 w, i32 h);
870typedef void (* RGFW_windowRestoredfunc)(RGFW_window* win, i32 x, i32 y, i32 w, i32 h);
872typedef void (* RGFW_windowMaximizedfunc)(RGFW_window* win, i32 x, i32 y, i32 w, i32 h);
874typedef void (* RGFW_windowMinimizedfunc)(RGFW_window* win);
876typedef void (* RGFW_windowQuitfunc)(RGFW_window* win);
878typedef void (* RGFW_focusfunc)(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_bool inFocus);
880typedef void (* RGFW_mouseNotifyfunc)(RGFW_window* win, i32 x, i32 y, RGFW_bool status);
882typedef void (* RGFW_mousePosfunc)(RGFW_window* win, i32 x, i32 y, float vecX, float vecY);
884typedef void (* RGFW_dataDragfunc)(RGFW_window* win, i32 x, i32 y);
886typedef void (* RGFW_windowRefreshfunc)(RGFW_window* win);
888typedef void (* RGFW_keyfunc)(RGFW_window* win, u8 key, u8 sym, RGFW_keymod mod, RGFW_bool repeat, RGFW_bool pressed);
890typedef void (* RGFW_mouseButtonfunc)(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_mouseButton button, RGFW_bool pressed);
892typedef void (* RGFW_mouseScrollfunc)(RGFW_window* win, float x, float y);
894typedef void (* RGFW_dataDropfunc)(RGFW_window* win, char** files, size_t count);
896typedef void (* RGFW_scaleUpdatedfunc)(RGFW_window* win, float scaleX, float scaleY);
897
899typedef void (*RGFW_proc)(void);
900
901#ifndef RGFW_NO_MONITOR
902
904typedef struct RGFW_monitorMode {
905 i32 w, h;
906 u32 refreshRate;
907 u8 red, blue, green;
908} RGFW_monitorMode;
909
911typedef struct RGFW_monitor {
912 i32 x, y;
913 char name[128];
914 float scaleX, scaleY;
915 float pixelRatio;
916 float physW, physH;
917 RGFW_monitorMode mode;
918} RGFW_monitor;
919
921typedef RGFW_ENUM(u8, RGFW_modeRequest) {
922 RGFW_monitorScale = RGFW_BIT(0),
923 RGFW_monitorRefresh = RGFW_BIT(1),
924 RGFW_monitorRGB = RGFW_BIT(2),
925 RGFW_monitorAll = RGFW_monitorScale | RGFW_monitorRefresh | RGFW_monitorRGB
926};
927
928#endif

948 RGFW_glES

955};

958typedef struct RGFW_glHints {
959 i32 stencil;
960 i32 samples;
961 i32 stereo;
962 i32 auxBuffers;
963 i32 doubleBuffer;
964 i32 red, green, blue, alpha;
965 i32 depth;
966 i32 accumRed, accumGreen, accumBlue, accumAlpha;
967 RGFW_bool sRGB;
968 RGFW_bool robustness;
969 RGFW_bool debug;
970 RGFW_bool noError;
971 RGFW_glReleaseBehavior releaseBehavior;
972 RGFW_glProfile profile;
973 i32 major, minor;
974 RGFW_glContext* share;
975 RGFW_eglContext* shareEGL;
976 RGFW_glRenderer renderer;
977} RGFW_glHints;
978
979#endif

2597 typedef union RGFW_gfxContext {

2599 RGFW_eglContext* egl;
2600 } RGFW_gfxContext;

2603 RGFW_gfxNativeOpenGL = RGFW_BIT(0),
2604 RGFW_gfxEGL = RGFW_BIT(1),

2691#endif /* RGFW_X11 */

2705 RGFW_bool pending_maximized;

2774typedef struct RGFW_windowInternal {
2776 RGFW_key exitKey;
2777 i32 lastMouseX, lastMouseY;
2779 RGFW_bool shouldClose;
2780 RGFW_bool holdMouse;
2781 RGFW_bool inFocus;
2782 RGFW_bool mouseInside;
2783 RGFW_keymod mod;
2784 RGFW_eventFlag enabledEvents;
2785 u32 flags;
2786 i32 oldX, oldY, oldW, oldH;
2787} RGFW_windowInternal;
2788
2789struct RGFW_window {
2790 RGFW_window_src src;
2791 RGFW_windowInternal internal;
2792 void* userPtr; /* ptr for usr data */
2793 i32 x, y, w, h;
2794};
2796typedef struct RGFW_windowState {
2797 RGFW_bool mouseEnter;
2798 RGFW_bool dataDragging;
2799 RGFW_bool dataDrop;
2800 size_t filesCount;
2801 i32 dropX, dropY;
2802 RGFW_window* win;
2804 RGFW_bool mouseLeave;
2805 RGFW_window* winLeave;
2806} RGFW_windowState;
2807
2808typedef struct {
2809 RGFW_bool current;
2810 RGFW_bool prev;
2811} RGFW_keyState;
2812
2813#ifndef RGFW_NO_MONITOR
2814 typedef struct RGFW_monitorNode {
2815 RGFW_monitor mon;
2816 struct RGFW_monitorNode* next;
2817#ifdef RGFW_WAYLAND
2818 u32 id; /* Add id so wl_outputs can be removed */
2819 struct wl_output *output;
2820 struct zxdg_output_v1 *xdg_output;
2821#endif
2822 } RGFW_monitorNode;
2823
2824 typedef struct RGFW_monitorList {
2825 RGFW_monitorNode* head;
2826 RGFW_monitorNode* cur;
2827 } RGFW_monitorList;
2828
2829 typedef struct RGFW_monitors {
2830 RGFW_monitorList list;
2831 RGFW_monitorList freeList;
2832 size_t count;
2833 RGFW_monitorNode data[RGFW_MAX_MONITORS];
2834 } RGFW_monitors;
2835
2836 RGFWDEF RGFW_monitorNode* RGFW_monitors_add(RGFW_monitor mon);
2837 RGFWDEF void RGFW_monitors_remove(RGFW_monitorNode* node, RGFW_monitorNode* prev);
2838#endif
2839
2840struct RGFW_info {
2841 RGFW_window* root;
2842 i32 windowCount;
2843
2844 RGFW_mouse* hiddenMouse;
2845
2846 RGFW_event events[RGFW_MAX_EVENTS]; /* A circular buffer (FIFO), using eventBottom/Len */
2847
2848 i32 eventBottom;
2849 i32 eventLen;
2850 RGFW_bool queueEvents;
2851 RGFW_bool polledEvents;
2852
2853 u32 apiKeycodes[RGFW_keyLast];
2854 #if defined(RGFW_X11) || defined(RGFW_WAYLAND)
2855 u8 keycodes[256];
2856 #elif defined(RGFW_WINDOWS)
2857 u8 keycodes[512];
2858 #elif defined(RGFW_MACOS)
2859 u8 keycodes[128];
2860 #elif defined(RGFW_WASM)
2861 u8 keycodes[256];
2862 #endif
2863
2864 const char* className;
2865 RGFW_bool useWaylandBool;
2866 RGFW_bool stopCheckEvents_bool ;
2867 u64 timerOffset;
2868
2869 char* clipboard_data;
2870 char* clipboard; /* for writing to the clipboard selection */
2871 size_t clipboard_len;
2872 char filesSrc[RGFW_MAX_PATH * RGFW_MAX_DROPS];
2873 char** files;
2874 #ifdef RGFW_X11
2875 Display* display;
2876 XContext context;
2877 Window helperWindow;
2878 const char* instName;
2879 XErrorEvent* x11Error;
2880 #endif
2881 #ifdef RGFW_WAYLAND
2882 struct wl_display* wl_display;
2883 struct xkb_context *xkb_context;
2884 struct xkb_keymap *keymap;
2885 struct xkb_state *xkb_state;
2886 struct zxdg_decoration_manager_v1 *decoration_manager;
2887 struct zwp_relative_pointer_manager_v1 *relative_pointer_manager;
2888 struct zwp_relative_pointer_v1 *relative_pointer;
2889 struct zwp_pointer_constraints_v1 *constraint_manager;
2890 struct xdg_toplevel_icon_manager_v1 *icon_manager;
2891
2892 struct zxdg_output_manager_v1 *xdg_output_manager;
2893
2894 struct wl_data_device_manager *data_device_manager;
2895 struct wl_data_device *data_device; // supports clipboard and DND
2896
2897 struct wl_keyboard* wl_keyboard;
2898 struct wl_pointer* wl_pointer;
2899 struct wl_compositor* compositor;
2900 struct xdg_wm_base* xdg_wm_base;
2901 struct wl_shm* shm;
2902 struct wl_seat *seat;
2903 struct wl_registry *registry;
2904 u32 mouse_enter_serial;
2905 struct wl_cursor_theme* wl_cursor_theme;
2906 struct wl_surface* cursor_surface;
2907
2908 RGFW_window* kbOwner;
2909
2910 #endif
2911
2912 RGFW_monitors monitors;
2913
2914 #ifdef __linux__
2915 int eventWait_forceStop[3];
2916 #endif
2917
2918 #ifdef RGFW_MACOS
2919 void* NSApp;
2920 void* customViewClasses[2]; /* NSView and NSOpenGLView */
2921 void* customWindowDelegateClass;
2922 #endif
2923
2924 #ifdef RGFW_OPENGL
2925 RGFW_window* current;
2926 #endif
2927 #ifdef RGFW_EGL
2928 void* EGL_display;
2929 #endif
2930
2931 RGFW_window* mouseOwner;
2932 RGFW_windowState windowState;
2934 RGFW_keyState mouseButtons[RGFW_mouseFinal];
2935 RGFW_keyState keyboard[RGFW_keyLast];
2936 float scrollX, scrollY;
2937 float vectorX, vectorY;
2938};
2939#endif /* RGFW_NATIVE_HEADER */

2957RGFWDEF void RGFW_resetKey(void);
2958RGFWDEF void RGFW_unloadEGL(void);
2959RGFWDEF void RGFW_updateKeyModsEx(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_bool capital, RGFW_bool numlock, RGFW_bool control, RGFW_bool alt, RGFW_bool shift, RGFW_bool super, RGFW_bool scroll);
2960RGFWDEF void RGFW_updateKeyMods(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_bool capital, RGFW_bool numlock, RGFW_bool scroll);
2961RGFWDEF void RGFW_window_showMouseFlags(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_bool show);
2962RGFWDEF void RGFW_updateKeyMod(RGFW_window* win, RGFW_keymod mod, RGFW_bool value);
2963
2964RGFWDEF void RGFW_setBit(u32* var, u32 mask, RGFW_bool set);
2965RGFWDEF void RGFW_splitBPP(u32 bpp, RGFW_monitorMode* mode);
2966
2967RGFWDEF void RGFW_captureCursor(RGFW_window* win);
2968RGFWDEF void RGFW_releaseCursor(RGFW_window* win);

2971 u8* src_data, RGFW_format src_format, RGFW_bool is64bit);

2973RGFWDEF RGFW_bool RGFW_loadEGL(void);

2978 size_t count;
2979 size_t max;
2980} RGFW_attribStack;
2981RGFWDEF void RGFW_attribStack_init(RGFW_attribStack* stack, i32* attribs, size_t max);
2982RGFWDEF void RGFW_attribStack_pushAttrib(RGFW_attribStack* stack, i32 attrib);
2983RGFWDEF void RGFW_attribStack_pushAttribs(RGFW_attribStack* stack, i32 attrib1, i32 attrib2);

2990#ifdef RGFW_X11

2992#endif
